channel.title: Help!
channel.description: how do i get my easy rsc server online? i know i have to portforward but what else?? we use belkin for our router thing.

item.title: Help!

item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

pesterd:

lol is it glade or blade

His Mopar account name is Blade, but he always uses Glade ingame and on his forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

[quote=“total annihilation, post:1, topic:276054”]Ok, go to 192.168.1.1 in the address bar of your internet browser. the default username is admin, with admin as the password.

Then, look for an option called “port range forwarding”, or something similar.

Now, for the port range, type 43594 to 43594 (default rscd ports), and choose “TCP”. Also, set an IP Address for it (192.168.x.x), then put that IP Address into server.java (replacing “localhost”, but keeping the quotes).[/quote]
default is “admin” and “password” to not get him confused

Read full topic

@Alex1288 wrote:

[quote=“total annihilation, post:1, topic:276242”]He could have been more specific and said, “I need help with port forwarding.”, the first time.

Ugh.[/quote]

ffs sorry then man![br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 30, 2009, 05:55:29 pm[/size][hr]but blade its fine thanks anyway

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Bladex0x Bladex0x
item.description:
@Bladex0x wrote:

[quote=“Kozy, post:4, topic:276034”][quote author=Bladex0x link=topic=364579.msg2767417#msg2767417 date=1240894245]

Ok, go to 192.168.1.1 in the address bar of your internet browser. the default username is admin, with admin as the password.

Then, look for an option called “port range forwarding”, or something similar.

Now, for the port range, type 43594 to 43594 (default rscd ports), and choose “TCP”. Also, set an IP Address for it (192.168.x.x), then put that IP Address into server.java (replacing “localhost”, but keeping the quotes).
[/quote]also name the Application “rsc”

Lol, Glade you can name the Application anything you would like, lmao…

-Kozy[/quote]Just tryed to help…god…

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Kozy Kozy
item.description:
@Kozy wrote:

[quote=“Bladex0x, post:3, topic:276034”][quote author=total annihilation link=topic=364579.msg2767279#msg2767279 date=1240886536]
Ok, go to 192.168.1.1 in the address bar of your internet browser. the default username is admin, with admin as the password.

Then, look for an option called “port range forwarding”, or something similar.

Now, for the port range, type 43594 to 43594 (default rscd ports), and choose “TCP”. Also, set an IP Address for it (192.168.x.x), then put that IP Address into server.java (replacing “localhost”, but keeping the quotes).
[/quote]also name the Application “rsc”[/quote]

Lol, Glade you can name the Application anything you would like, lmao…

-Kozy

Read full topic
